remarks: Lemma for ~ lcfl7N .  If two functionals ` G ` and ` J ` are equal, they are determined by the same vector.  (Contributed by NM, 4-Jan-2015.)
statement:
lcfl7lem.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
lcfl7lem.o $e |- ._|_ = ( ( ocH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lcfl7lem.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lcfl7lem.v $e |- V = ( Base ` U ) $.
lcfl7lem.a $e |- .+ = ( +g ` U ) $.
lcfl7lem.t $e |- .x. = ( .s ` U ) $.
lcfl7lem.s $e |- S = ( Scalar ` U ) $.
lcfl7lem.r $e |- R = ( Base ` S ) $.
lcfl7lem.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` U ) $.
lcfl7lem.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` U ) $.
lcfl7lem.l $e |- L = ( LKer ` U ) $.
lcfl7lem.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
lcfl7lem.g $e |- G = ( v e. V |-> ( iota_ k e. R E. w e. ( ._|_ ` { X } ) v = ( w .+ ( k .x. X ) ) ) ) $.
lcfl7lem.j $e |- J = ( v e. V |-> ( iota_ k e. R E. w e. ( ._|_ ` { Y } ) v = ( w .+ ( k .x. Y ) ) ) ) $.
lcfl7lem.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. ( V \ { .0. } ) ) $.
lcfl7lem.x2 $e |- ( ph -> Y e. ( V \ { .0. } ) ) $.
lcfl7lem.gj $e |- ( ph -> G = J ) $.
lcfl7lem $p |- ( ph -> X = Y ) $.
$d .+ k v w $.
$d .0. w $.
$d ._|_ k v w $.
$d .x. k v w $.
$d R k v $.
$d S k w $.
$d V v $.
$d X k v w $.
$d Y k v w $.
